meanings.definition: The state of being unable to find one's way or unable to be found.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the deep lostness made it hard to know which path to take.
meanings.sent2: The lostness of the traveler was evident as he wandered aimlessly in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent3: The lostness of the puppy in the large park led to a comical chase as the owner tried to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Her lostness in the sea of faces at the crowded concert made her feel invisible.
meanings.sent5: The lostness of the treasure in the vast desert added an air of mystery to the adventure.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being confused or without direction.
meanings.sent1: She experienced a sense of lostness when she realized she was in the wrong classroom.
meanings.sent2: The lostness in his mind was reflected in his furrowed brow as he tried to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The lostness of the children in the maze of mirrors created laughter as they bumped into their own reflections.
meanings.sent4: His lostness in the world of technology made him feel like a dinosaur in a digital age.
meanings.sent5: The lostness of the actor on stage added a touch of authenticity to his portrayal of a confused character.

meanings.definition: The quality of being wasted or not used effectively.
meanings.sent1: The lostness of the food left on the table after the party was a reminder of excess.
meanings.sent2: The lostness of her potential was a source of regret as she looked back on missed opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The lostness of the resources in the abandoned warehouse was a sad sight.
meanings.sent4: The lostness of time spent on trivial matters became apparent when deadlines approached.
meanings.sent5: The lostness of talent in the small town was a tragedy waiting to be discovered.
